intro: Mollinedia polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, triangular leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are typically greenish-white in color. Mollinedia polycarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
